page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Sandbach being a market town has excellent road links with all the surrounding areas.Two main roads converge or pass through the town centre.The A534 links the town with Congleton(seven miles to the east of Sandbach) and to the major rail town of Crewe,five miles to the south-west. The other main road,the A533, passes through Sandbach and links the town with Alsager,four miles to the south- east,and with Middlewich and Northwich to the north-west.From each of the towns mentioned it is then possible to reach any part of the North-West of England or Wales. However,Sandbach's greatest asset is its proximity to the M6 Motorway. Less than one mile from the town centre it provides links with the rest of the country through the remaining motorway network.
